Replies.Reply: A darkened diffused image of a man lying on the ground. A tree is above him. The image is more diffused on the edges.
Replies.Didascalie: (THE FILM IS IN COLOR UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED.)

Replies.Reply: Ladies and gentlemen, on the new tonight, the first actual motion pictures of death.
Watch closely, at the moment of death.

was educated in Roman Catholic Parochial schools with one year and a half at a Jesuit college. CHARLIE was raised sternly in the Roman Catholic tradition but now has rejected many of the religion's tenets. He is very intelligent and has a sharp sense of humor. He is always well dressed. His favorite authors are Ernest Hemingway, Thomas Hardy, and Theodore Dreiser. He likes reading but enjoys films more.
What the fuck...hey!
Not in my fuckin' place... get out... get out!
And keep the fuck out-a-here. I know your face.
George...did I ever tell you the story about the three chickens?
Too bad.
Which one, the big tab or the little tab?
Yeah, so things'll be even.
Yeah, in the back.
C'mon, I got something to show you anyway.
Excuse us Jimmy, we'll only be a moment.
S'alright Tony.
Keep quiet about this. I don't have any license for him yet. I've only had him a couple of days.
Really wanted to get a little tiger Charlie, y'know...a little William Blake and all that...
You are with out a doubt the biggest, most pretentious bullshit thrower I know. Like to see what kind of business you'd do.
We'll close up as soon as everybody leaves.
No.
Don't run...don't run. Everyone split up.
How much?
Can you spare it?
Thanks.
Hey Charlie. Get in.
Yeah.
Hallelujah!!
'Art thou the King of the Jews'?
Replies.Didascalie: (taking on the guise of an interviewer)

Replies.Reply: 'Am I a Jew? Thy own people and the chief priests have delivered thee to me. What hast thou done?'  MICHAEL and a few of the others gather around again as they continue.

'What is the truth?'  The others around them give mock applause. TONY smiles and nods his head to them. CHARLIE laughs. They drink. Someone hits CHARLIE on the back of the head. CHARLIE startled, looks up.
Prophesy to us, oh Christ! Who is it that struck thee?
Is it near Sullivan Street?
Oh - you gotta show me. I always get lost in the village.
Shut up.
Fuck youse all.
You're over an hour late. Michael said he'll be back later, though...
Jewish...
Look at her.
Sure she is. She's always in here with some different guy. You know the way they are.
...No bullets in it.
Get out of here before this really goes up.
Ok...but go to a movie first or something...not good to be driving around right away. You know you can't do much for him now...it's out of your hands.
Where to?
I know, I know, stupid. I mean where you goin'?
So?
Nervous?
You flew before?
Take it easy. I only asked because maybe I could, you know, let you have a little something.
How about Teresa? I could talk...
And say what?
Listen, try a place with some sun.
Panther...
Hey...no more good times like before. Until you come back.
Yeah, I'm gonna worry about you, too.
See you.
...huh?
Hey I didn't do nothin'...cut it out...
I'm just waiting for Joey.
There's nobody here mister.
Yeah. But he ain't here now.
Follow me.
Thanks.
Well, we're here for about two weeks, then whatever else comes along... we're still working on our album and...
Sounds good.
What do you mean?
...let's go.
Let's go!
Look fella...this is private...
Let go of her.
Hey, hurry up with that shit will ya.
Naw...that ain't shit...that's a German lens.
A good buy...good two shipments of them.
Why...? That's a telescopic one...
A Jap adaptor?
For these prices don't be particular.
Sell 'em if you can't smoke them.
You seen Johnny Boy tonight?
Isn't he supposed to be here tonight...I mean...
I'd like to know Charlie, it looks like your little friend is trying to duck me...
...Charlie, don't you think you should be interested in Johnny's payments to me? I think you should be, you know that.
I know that Charlie but look at my side. You undersigned the loans.
I don't know that. That's what I'm telling you.
OK.
How about me? I don't get a drink John?
You what?
OK, get in.
Get in, get in.
Just keep him quiet.
Shut up.
Quiet please.
Where should I drop you Charlie?
Hey, shut up.
Ok...that's it.
Out!!!!
You getting out too?
I gave him all the breaks I can give.
Nevamind 'look'...This punk bastard...I call him at work...I say 'Johnny Boy there?'...He doesn't even show up for work anymore...
All right...but understand, I don't like being taken advantage of. I mean you're in there talking with your uncle and all...This is embarassing.
Sssh! Quiet.
Y'know that's illegal.
Yeah, yeah, never mind. You gotta be careful.
Yeah, well, keep away from those Chinx. They don't have shit.
give you...
Hey! You want good stuff, or you want shit?
Well, my stuff comes from Maryland...
That means it's good.
Yeah.
the packs.
You sure?
Ok. Wait here.
C'mon. Get in the car.
Ok, you guys get out, and wait here for me.
I gotta get the stuff.
Nobody sees where I get the stuff.
Hey hold it! Gimmie the cash.
A check? What the...hey, where you kids from?
Well, maybe they do that in Riverdale, but down here we take cash. Now, you got it or not?
Ok. Now wait here...and keep your mouths shut!
Sure.
Nothin'. Just stiffed those kids.
Ok guys...have a heart. This is my business.
You sure?...a nigger...Uh!...and I kissed her.
Well, he isn't. Nice...real nice.
You kiddin. The way it is now this isn't even interest for two hours.
wanted to pay off his other loans...
Charlie, this is business.
I'll tell you who you can pray for... Next payday, I'll be at Tony's Place...Johnny better show or I find him and break his legs...and I mean it.
He could at least show some respect and show his face, even if he doesn't have the money...
You said it.
Be seeing you and Johnny tonight...
I tell you, Charlie. If that kid doesn't show up tonight...
...I'm gonna find him, drag him down here, tie one of his legs to that Ford bumper over here...
...and his other leg to that Chrysler over there.
...and bam!!!
Whatever.
What's it gonna be? I was here tonight...you kept me waiting for over an hour.
Better than nothing.
Where's the rest?
Twenty-eight bucks is enough of an insult...I was gonna take the twenty-eight bucks because of Charlie here...but ten bucks!
You're not going to use that gun, Johnny.
You don't have the guts to use that...be seeing you Charlie, Tony, and of course you John...be seeing you.
What's this? More shit...?
Can't use it...
First, it ain't German...it's Japanese...and second, this ain't no lens...it's like a...a...an adaptor...so you got two shipments of Jap adaptors with no lenses.
MAN hands adaptor back to MICHAEL.
A...As you know, I've just come out of Confession. And as a penance they gave me ten 'Hail Marys' and ten 'Our Fathers'...
...Now, between you and me... You know how I feel about such things...
...If I'm going to do penance at all, I'll do it the way I think it would be done...by me, that is...according to my own trespasses.
Y'know...she's really good-looking...
Oh great...hey - Winstons?
OK, ok...
No...I'll be ok for a week.
Nope...
Look...I don't know. What am I supposed to be, his keeper or something? Yeah, he's supposed to be here but who knows what goes on in his head. Right?
Michael, nobody's out to screw you, I guarrantee that.
You're right. You're right. Look, I'm not gonna wind up paying his debts. You know that.
Michael, believe me. You know the kid's a little crazy sometimes. I vouched for him and he'll come through. I promise. I'll talk to him and straighten him out. Don't worry, OK?

What do you think? 'If a man have a hundred sheep, and one of them stray, will he not leave the ninety-nine in the mountains, and go in search of the one that has strayed? And if he happen to find it, amen I say to you, he rejoices over it more than over the ninety-
Giovanino! Where have you been?
The queen!
What happened to you Flash?
I know but let's hear it anyway.
All right, forget it. Tony, you got anything we can put on his face?
Don't go to any trouble. We believe you... We believe you.
Be careful.
I'm surprised at you Tone. I mean you've had the place for over a year now. Nothing different...same old place...ordinary...flat...no imagination.

For instance, the difference between me and you is this...you take that panther back there. I'd put him right up here above the bar...nice cage, you know? Nothing ordinary in my place. What good is it? You get robot customers. They come in, drink beer, go to the bathroom, and go home. No sir.
See what I mean?
Well, go ahead, whaddaya want?
This place is dead. If I had a place...every night...lively.
And I wouldn't call it TONY'S PLACE or CHARLIE'S PLACE...
I'd call it something like SEASON OF THE WITCH... get it?
Look who's talking. Pretentious bullshit. Who's the guy with William Blake and the tigers, eh?
Don't forget what's-his-name there in the bathroom.
Not quite...but keep trying.
Let's have a game after we close.
C'mon Tony, waddaya say?
Anybody wanna have a game?
Michael, give us a lift.
Oh Jesus Christ...what's this.
Should I slap him?
I can't get over the way he just kept going at him.
Away from the neighborhood.
Get him in.
Disgraceful.
C'mon Johnny.
Yeah, thanks, it's ok.
Don't answer.
No, she isn't.
Listen, I'll be ok...it's the best thing. You're not going to be able to take care of Grandma out here and still get to work, you know that...
Yes the place will be here, I'll take care of it.
Yeah don't worry about me, I'll take care of myself.
He moves into the bedroom taking more items out of the drawers. The room is ver small. The paint if peeling.
No...no parties.
I'll eat.
Mom, look, just don't worry...ok?
You'd better make a move kid. He thinks you're trying to screw him.
Yeah, big man...get yourself in more trouble. You make a fool out of him, you're doing the same to me.
You couldn't handle shit. You just better come through with some kind of payment on Tuesday...anything.
What do you mean?
You sick or what? You forget what we had to do to get you on the trucks, stupid?
You're not supposed to like it.
I'll tell you what I don't do... I don't owe anybody 2,000 clams plus interest, stupid. Show up or I break both your arms, we understand each other?
Don't promise...just deliver.
I won't wait until Tuesday. I'll break your arms right now.
I could have told you that.
Don't do that. You'll scare Teresa if you try to sneak in.
That's not funny. You gonna be a jerk-off all your life. Grow up.
Ok, we'll go for lunch.
Well...with the hotel that's ten...
Well...
Sure...it's not that...I mean...
Well, if things go the way I hope they'll go, this money business will take care of itself.
God willing.
Maybe, who knows.
Nobody knows anything, believe me.
See if you can get your hands on some pamphlets on laws or by laws...or proprietorship...you know...at your place.
You know...like restaurants, night clubs...
Don't ask.
Did you?
CHRIST, you should have seen it.

You missed the point. The kid's a climber...not very bright...but if you get down to his level to look at it his way; he kills a guy who insulted a big man - he gets a reputation. He thinks he's in good standing.
Not sick...just stupid. Speaking of stupid, your cousin last night was feeling so good he decided to break into your mother's house...to get some food.
Don't worry.

Don't look at me like that, I can see this is not going to get us anywhere. She's a good kid, what am I supposed to do. In a way I'm doing her a favor...no??? How many guys you know feel this way about an epileptic? Don't get me wrong, I'm no saint...not yet.
But I'm not like the Pharisee who said "Oh God I thank thee that I am not like the rest of them."...no...I like to think of myself as the Publican...
...'Oh God be merciful to me the sinner!' I'm not taking advantage of her. I swear to you that if she meets someone she'd like to marry...
...I'll cut out. "If Thy eye is an occasion of sin to thee...
...pluck it out and cast it from thee." "Woe to the man through whom scandal does come." I'm sure you'd agree this is no time to get tied down. Like the priesthood...
...they don't get tied down do they?
...first last. For many are called but few are chosen."
Ok, how's everything going?
No.
What pipes?
That bad, huh?
Not next week's either...listen...you tell that to Giovanni, not me.
He'd rather have the loan payed, you know that.
I don't understand, where's Groppi?
My uncle figured that this week was bad...but about next week...I dunno.
Is my uncle back there?
Thanks!
Marie, are there Columbian coffee beans in this coffee?
Just a second. Let me taste it.
MARIE is disinterested. CHARLIE continues.
You see. You probably don't notice this Marie, but Colombian coffee beans are rich coffee beans.
Then the bean pickers come down and pick each bean by hand. Bean by bean, all heavy with flavor. And they load them into boxes, one box at a time, box by box.

Like, looking at my uncle back there. One way is the obvious; ...man outside the law. On the other hand, instead of a breakdown of order there is a creation of order and instead of the breakdown of law, there is the creation of law...In this society which needs new law because 'What's a crowbar compared to a share of stock.
Uncle, how are you feeling?
About that shooting last night...I was there and...
You're right uncle. I must have gotten it confused with something else.
About Oscar...I think he put on this act...about the restaurant being in bad shape and all that.
Yes...I understand...I'll be careful.
No...we can come back in a couple of weeks. Besides, if we're both gone for three days it wouldn't look right.
Bore.
Yeah...but don't worry about that now. The Hemmingway one is first.
Take your time. I don't care.
That's the word...preoccupied.
Let's go back inside.
See that...know who lives there?
No. Of course he lives there.
That W.A.S.P. bastard.
Watch your language.
Uhuh...probably a good idea. Why don't you do it this time?
Well you can't blame them in a way.
I know...I know.
...He must have heard the name from those T.V.'s in the hall that were blaring all the time. I remember GUEVARA was in town at the time.
Of all people. Now say the truth.
You've been running round too much.
I...I'm selling encyclopedias...er a magazines...newspapers...I'm conducting a survey...I...
Isn't this Jack Groppi's place?
Know where he is?
How much farther?
Now, don't get excited.
'The stone which the builders' reject will become the cornerstone'...I think.
Ok.
Oh...around...why?
Who me? ...No, I don't know, not me...all I know is...
Not now...in a few minutes...ok?
Oh Michael, look...
Look...I've talked to him and I've talked to him...what more can I do...? Tonight at the party all three of us get together and we knock some sense into his head...ok?
We'll settle it tonight.
Firecrackers! No...no.
Sure, see that guy over there...
...him. He's got the best.
What's a'matter?
How much?
Let's go to the movies...on you.

You know damn well what's going to happen tonight. I'll probably get drunk at that party...it isn't every day you send one of your best friends off to war for God and country... gotta have a party. I mean, he's a nice kid.

I don't know what You think of him but that's between You and him anyway...I can't help feeling sorry for him though. Has a talent but doesn't use it...His brain. An 'Unprofitable servant who shall be cast forth into the darkness outside, where there will be...
...the weeping and the gnashing of teeth'...or something like that.
That's there and I'm here and that's the way it's going to stay!
I have come to create order...
May God be with you.
Salute!!!
'My kingdom is not of this world.
'Thou sayest it; I am a king. This is why I was born and why I have come into this world, to bear witness to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth hears my voice.'  TONY leans over towards CHARLIE.
I don't know, but God help him if he does it again!
He said he'd be here.
He'll be here. Look, take this for now.
How much was the original loan again?

Replies.Reply: 'But I say to you not to resist the evildoer; on the contrary, if someone takes thy tunic, let him take thy cloak as well...to him who asks of thee, give; and from him who would borrow of thee do not turn away!
'Father...forgive them...for they know not...what they do...'  The doorbell rings and TONY answers it. It is TERESA and she looks very worried.
Now don't get excited. Don't get excited!!
Johnny it's me, Charlie.
Cut it out stupid. It's me.
What are you...crazy?
Stupid bastard...you get your cousin half-sick over this.
What the fuck...
Let's get out of here.
That's not going to help.
that, flash?
Big deal...in the meantime, it's done...I'll still try to help you out...You know that...but you gotta show some effort...some respect...
How?
That'll help you out fine. That's the best way for you, not for me!
I don't get involved with anything, you understand that? Nothing! I'm clean as far as you know...right?

That's what I get for getting involved. Look, on pay-day at least show up at Tony's Place to meet him, ok? This way he doesn't think that you're trying to screw him. If you show good faith and save his face maybe we can talk and he'll take off the interest or make different payment arrangements or something... understand? I'm not asking I'm telling you!!
'Could you not, then, watch one hour with me?'  He wakes JOHNNY BOY up.
I really couldn't believe it when you told me, you know that?
Hemmingway. Killed himself. I was more upset about that than about Groppi, that's for sure.
Wasn't a book...was a short story.
Nothing.
"Francis Macomber."
"Short Happy Life of Francis Macomber."
Oh yes, he's pretty good.
It's only a couple of courses...just for the draft.
What did he do?
Teresa.
No, she's got epilepsy.
What do they expect you to say?
All right.
Oh, that's ok...I've been in and out of this place fifty times.
Oh yeah, that's a possibility.
...looks good...things look good, if I may say so myself. Don't you agree? Unless there's something You know that I don't know?
Hot as hell...You're not the only one going through Hell kid.
'If thy hand is an occasion of sin to thee, cut it off. It is better for thee to enter into life maimed than having two hands to go into hell, into the unquenchable fire.
Next time, bet with your own kind.
It'll be OK - I know those guys.
No - not yet - just blessed.
Oh Joey, really...we're all friends here--let's cut the bullshit.
Whatever, just lets settle this and it's all forgotten.
Keep your mouth shut.
C'mon -- I'm movin' in on you?
Shut up stupid.
You got some mouth!
You got no honor Tony. Charge!
No, really, I liked it...thought it was great.
What are your plans?
Great...great...listen, I'm very interested in you guys because I'll be opening a new club myself soon...
Of course, 'The Season of the Witch' won't be ready for a while yet but we have to keep in touch.

Teresa?...Yeah, Charlie. Listen, I'm looking for your cousin. Yeah, well today's Tuesday, payday. I haven't seen him all day...no...well, have you got any idea where he is? I know it's early yet but I'm just getting worried that's all...
Honey, I can't talk now...I've gotta run, bye.
I'll see you later.
Diane, how are you feeling?
You know Diane...I've been wanting to talk to you for a while now...er... a...
aside from all that joking around we do out there...when you're on...I... a...I really...think that you're a terrific performer...
No, I'm serious...You're really good.
In a little while...I'm gonna have the opportunity of opening my own place...not here...much nicer than this...uptown...sort of nite-club and restaurant and everything.
I was thinking maybe you'd do very nicely for the place.
No...no stripping...as the hostess.
Yeah, you know...you greet the people...see them to their tables...
Ok. Chinese. We'll meet on the corner of 6th Avenue and Waverly Place after you finish.
Bye.
We'll be here.
Look, Michael, I'll get him here.
Are you sure he didn't say anything to you about tonight?
...that sonofabitch.
Are you serious? Me move in with you. You crazy?
Teresa, get these ideas out of your head...I've got enough on my hands right now...with that bastard cousin of yours. You wanna move?
Where were you? Answer me, you sonofabitch! Where were you?
Shut up!
You had me going crazy!
Your cousin here was getting sick, worrying about you. We've been in here calling...
Don't be smart.
Johnny, I swear to God, if you open your mouth about any of this...
Go ahead! Go on! And we'll see what happens to you without me.
What do I do? You know anything about this?
You crazy bastard! What are you trying to do, ruin me?
You...
You threaten me with my uncle?
Then don't show up tonight and see what happens.
How much have you got for Michael tonight?
Here, take twenty bucks. With your eight that makes twenty-eight bucks you give Michael. I keep the thirteen for the weekend. Maybe we'll eat some Chinese food later.
Take it. I'm doing it for you, stupid!
Oh, cut it out, will ya?
NO!!! What do you think I am, crazy???
Come on.
Watch this kid for me. I have to go someplace but I'll be back soon to get Michael and him together.
Don't you move!!!
6th Avenue and Waverly Place, fast please.
No...don't stop...just pass real slow, OK?
Stop here.
No...what am I...crazy??? Take me back to where you picked me up.
Mind your own business.
You can see things aren't going too well for me at the moment. My willpower and powers of persuasion are not what they usually are today.
Who's the girl?
How do you know?
She don't look Jewish.
I love you.
Ever since that first day I saw you at the convent with the nuns, playing volleyball, I couldn't help myself.
Yeah why?
It's obvious that the girl doesn't want to accompany you, isn't it?
Nothing's private...
Whether she wants to or not...she's not going.
Take her away from me...I mean physically take her away from me.
He has about twenty-eight bucks...
Yeah, where's the rest?
You're really crazy.
You stupid bastard! Never pull a gun unless you intend to use it.
Hide the gun. Throw it away.
No.
Forget it.
Good idea.
I guess you could safely say that this evening has been so far very unimpressive as far as my efforts are concerned...more unproductive.
Go ahead! Play the radio...play music...you're going to a party...
Hey, what is this guy, crazy?
My uncle didn't come?
Kennedy.
So I'll send you a postcard from wherever. If I get there.
Yeah.
No.
Hey, come on...
Yeah, well thanks, but I got enough to hold me. My mother can send me some. I don't know.
Listen, I appreciate it, but I'll handle it myself. I'll write.
I'll say that I'm travelling.
Thanks for the ride.
Take care of that tiger.
Panther! Same thing...
Sure. And you're gonna take the vows next Tuesday, right.
I don't know what to say to you...
Where can I go?
It's ten o'clock and they're like this. And they're just starting?
Smile...What are you smiling at?
No...
We're closed.
Drinks for everybody Tony...
and a double for you and Charlie here.
And put it on my tab, willya?
Put it on the little tab so that it balances with the big one.
Of course! A double for Michael, Tony.
I know what you're going to say but don't say it. These drinks are all on the tab. I'm gonna see you this Tuesday payday, I promise. I give you my word.
Charlie, I swear on my mother, you're not going to believe this.
I swear to God Charlie, it's the truth.
Sal!... fourteen street.
This is some boat. Your father's?
Hey... you got stereo.
You got a speaker back there?
Ah...there's a funny lookin' cab behind us.
What'sa matter...forget your registration?
Yeah, it's your father's.
You mean it's heisted.
This is a heisted car!
It's the truth, I swear.
Tony, break down and open another bottle willya'?
Will you guys shut up with the witches and tigers. Tony, you gonna close the place, we get out of here, get something to eat, or what?
Nah.
Yes, you're gettin' it all over my tie.
Friends of yours Michael.
Must have been all the liquor in him.
What...are you kidding.
I don't think I should go home looking like this. You think I could stay at your place tonight?
Wouldn't bother me.
Don't worry. I can handle it.
There won't be any this week.
Didn't show up.
I don't like loading crates.
What about your attitude...Where's your job...eh? You talk and talk and I go to work...what do you do?
Ok, ok...take it easy. I'll show.
Ok, now that that's over with...what are you gonna make me for breakfast?
Listen...I'm a guest here.
OK...ok...I'm going.
Hey...you got nothing here.
We'll get some food from my aunt's.
Yeah...you're right. Maybe she'll have a seizure and we can watch.
I'm not hungry anymore. I'm going to bed.
Hello...fifth precinct? Yeah...I want to report a disturbance. Yeah this man and woman next door are disturbing the peace. They're keeping me awake all night now.
Don't come any closer!!!
Charlie...pssst. Over here.
Hey...don't do that...I'm only scaring them.
Watch this.
Did you see them run!
I swear to God Charlie...my arm still hurts from the car accident...that's why I didn't go to work. I swear it.
I'm going to work this week...I mean it.
I'm sorry Charlie...I didn't mean it.
Charlie, you know the best way to take care of this whole mess.
If you had a little talk with your uncle...if anybody can do it, he can.
Yeah, take it easy. Will you relax.
I understand.
Yeah, yeah - enough.
I don't forget nothin.
Lower the fuckin music--I can't hear nothin.
Girls? You call those skanks girls?!
I feel fine--nothing wrong with me.
You tell me that in front of these creeps?
is a...mook.
Count it.
Don't fuckin' touch me - scumbag.
What're ya hollering? You got your money.
Yeah, Teresa, shut up! We don't wanna get Charlie here in trouble, do we?...We love Charlie.
Oh, that's too bad, Teresa...
Well kids...have the bans been announced yet?
I'm not smart...I'm stupid, remember.
Don't be upset Teresa. You have to understand Charlie, here...he gives of himself to help others...
No, you stay.
Me? I wouldn't say a word to my aunt and uncle...or even your uncle, Charlie...
Charlie...I always wondered about her...what happens when she comes?
You rat bastard!! Don't hit me again!!
I think I will fuckin go see your uncle right now...he'd be interested.
I don't know...she's your girl...I gotta go.
Hate to miss the floor show, though.
What you're doing for me isn't worth it...believe me!
I only got eight bucks on me.
No you're not...
Charlie, twenty-eight bucks is nothing. The only way to do it is through your uncle...think about it will you?
No, I just want to help myself, that's all.
I'll be here. Don't worry.
Back so soon.
Hello, Michael. I've got something for you...not much...but...
I bought a few rounds of drinks while waiting.

You make me laugh, Michael...you know that? I've borrowed money all over the neighborhood and never paid it back...so I couldn't borrow anymore from them...so who's the only jerk off left that I can borrow from without paying back...YOU. Because that's what I think of you...Jerk off. I fuck you where you breathe!
I think we should see your uncle.
This can't be settled any other way now...I'll take full blame.
What are you going to do? Hide me?
What are you talking to yourself???
The queen!
Hey Johnny, where're you goin'?
Come on.
Yeah...just had it delivered...
Yeah, I think so.
I know...I know.
No...no. Nooo...it's just that I...I...uh... this ain't my car.
Well...no.

I told you there was something in this room.
You Italian?
You don't look it.
Fuck off.
You go...I'm staying.
I'd like to leave.
Stop it...you're hurting me.
Ahhh come on baby...willya'...cut it out.
Wanna see your picture?
Waddaya think?
No - by Bedford.
The number was 235 - I bet it combination.
Why? We just said...
But I didn't say nothin.
A mook...I'm a mook...
What's a mook?
You can't call me a mook!
Johnny, you're a real jerk-off.
I...I gotta go to the bathroom.
Michael...wait.
Sammy get control of yourself.
I'm terribly sorry guys...It's just that he was terribly frightened.
Oh...ah...I'm Benton and this is Sammy.
Sammy.
Sammy, get in here this minute.
You wouldn't dare.
Yes Charlie, your place or mine.
Oh Benton...look!
Hi beautiful!!! I love you.
I won't...I won't! They're all beautiful.
I'll suck them all...I'll suck them all!
Going our way?

Do you have enough?
Here.
Please take it.
I don't mind.
It's all right.
An apartment uptown? Downtown?
Charlie...?
Anything specific?
What is it now?
Alright... Hey, did you hear any more about what happened last night?
No.
It doesn't make any sense. He wouldn't shoot him just because he insulted a racket guy...not unless it was personal.
It's still sick.
You're sure he doesn't know.
C'mon Charlie...one more day. I'll call in sick for work.
Ok.
A paper on that one too?
It was nothing. I'm almost finished.
I know you don't. You've been very preoccupied lately.
Sure...He lives there?
You're intolerable today.
I like it here...alone.
I'm going to take that apartment uptown.
You know why...with my parents.
I can take care of myself. You know that.
Ummmmmmmmmmmmm.
I'm sleepy.
The green capsules in the top drawer.
Oh sure! I know her Michael...In fact, I saw her a few days ago under a bridge in Jersey, making out with a nigger.
Charlie...? Charlie here...?
The building on the corner. That one! He's been on the roof a half hour now!
Charlie...I've got to see you. I want to talk...
But...
For God's Sakes...I told you before...nothing.
Charlie, I can't stay in here too long at this hour...will you please listen to me?
But Charlie...it's uptown and it's perfect. It's big enough for two people...she's going to get out by the end of the month. If you don't act right away, it'll go in no time.
Don't you realize what that apartment means?
Do you? For both of us. Think...
I'm going to go home.
No...no...don't.
Hey, cut it out. Will ya?
Hey...you're here. They told me you're here...and you're here. How are you?
Don't ask...do you have any idea what I've been doing all morning...eh?
I was in the basement fixing the pipes. Would you believe that?
What pipes...the ones from last year...those pipes.
Look Charlie, you're a good boy.
I can't make this week's payment and if this keeps up not next week's either.
Listen, I should wrap up this place in a ribbon and hand it to him, you know that. I don't need this aggravation. I'm getting old.

Your Uncle's a good man...I won't stick him. Either he gets the money or the place and right now he's getting the place. And tell me why should I care? I got a partner who's a bum, who doesn't help out...who disappears and leaves me with all the problems. I should go back to Florida...I don't need this.
I should know? His wife don't even know. Probably off with one of his little girls...I don't know. I tell you, if he don't give a damn, then I don't give a damn...Why should I kill myself?
What can I say?
Put the menus away. I, personally do the cooking tonight.
Capozelle, Calamari...anything you want...
Giovanni...er...can I talk?
About the place, Giovanni...
Our arrangements about the place haven't changed, have they? I mean...
Sure, Giovanni...I understand.
Yeah, but I think he's busy now.
What I'm telling you is that he did it for Mario's honor.
Giovanni - an insult to Mario is an insult to you.
The boy only did what was right.
But you don't understand. I knew the kid. He was drunk. He made of fool of himself...not me.
There was no insult.
Calamari?
What was it?
No, c'mon...Y'know, I read.
Wha?
Oh yeah...didn't read it but I saw the movie...Gregory Peck...pretty good.
I like this Harold Robbins...
Charlie, couple of courses isn't enough to get you student deferred...
In the fifties when the communists started in with this country and they tried to clean them out, we offered to do it for them...but they didn't want us to...so we kept out of it.
Why don't you take a look around the place if you want?
Giovanni says now he done enough.
He says use it. Don't sell it. He says he'll see you. Someday. Maybe.
Things worked out rotten kid. Sorry.
Your son only did what was stupid.
Fine. Did you have a good time last night?
No you weren't.
Yes, you did.
No...his business is bad. But I'll decide what to do and you...and you just keep out of anything that might...might...er draw attention to you.
Play it again!!!
Take a drink!
Hey, where you been?
You heard what happened to GROPPI, eh?
Our friend, Groppi, went to his mother's house. And when he was there...at night...

Replies.Reply: ...he walks into his mother's room where she's watching television...and he says to her...
...that he's sorry.
...he goes in the next room...
...he takes a gun and puts it in his mouth and...

Fine...that's why I'm here.
Drink.
...I know all about it. We'll discuss it later.
No, no, not at all...look, we leave it the way it is for now, we talk later, understand?
Well, he was always a little crazy... he puts a gun in his mouth...
...like your friend...comme si chiama...Henning? Heming?
You know, this boy over here, once, long time ago, tried to enrich my mind...so he gives me a book by this Hemin fella...to read, so I read it.
Yeh, Mario over here, he reads a lot.
Surprised?
What I don't understand is why you have to go to college to read these books that you're gonna read anyway.
What Mario's trying to tell you, Charlie, is that you're wasting your time with those "couple of courses" ...you don't need them.
These politicians...they talk nice.

...but it's the same thing, all the same...they're in there by having something on somebody...and when that doesn't work...they fight...Our life has honor...we have no show to put on because we do what we have to do. They know where to come when they need us. I realize this during the war...World War II...Vito Genovese... during WWII he worked with the government, taking care of the docks...
What did he do? He was there...
I told this...the same thing to your father thirty years ago...I told him what to do...but he didn't listen.
You're still around with that kid Johnny Boy...last night with that gun...Don't get mixed up with them.
His whole family has problems...his cousin, the girl who lives next door to you...
...The one who's sick, right? In the head.
Yeah. That's what I said, sick in the head.
Her mother and father come to me and ask advice...she wants to leave...get her own apartment...worries them sick...what am I gonna tell them? Lock her up?

Who knows? It's not hard to figure out what she'll wind up like. When the respect for parents breaks down, that's bad...you know I'm "cumpari" with them...so I take an interest. You live next door, keep an eye open...but don't get involved.
Well, maybe you missed something?
I dunno.
What do you want kid?
What do you want?.......well?
We don't want no fuckin' books!

It's all right.
Yeah.

Uh...can we give you a check?

I never heard of it.
...Well...
you got a good friend here--come to think of it, I do remember now.
